page.title: 19Council Houses
page.content: Council housing was first developed in the inter war years.The first estate at Alexandra Road Estate was completed between 1921 and 1923 and has been recently renovated.The Oval estate was built in the early thirties and the Kings Avenue estate followed in the mid thirties.These again have been modernised.The Dalelands estate was first developed privately in the late thirties.It was commandeered by the Air Ministry and in the 1970s the council purchased the estate.It was extended in the immediate post war years to Clifford Rd, Chestnut Rd and Dalelands West.The most controversial development was the Fairfields Estate. This open planned,terraced development of industrialised buildings has been regularly criticised because of lack of privacy and poor construction. The gardens are now enclosed.
